action->Shattering Scrape.description: The morthak makes a claw Strike against a creature wearing stone or metal armor. If the Strike hits and the armor's Hardness is 12 or lower, that armor is broken.

spell->Darkness (At-Will).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]
Darkness (At-Will)

action->Spectral Mount.name: Spectral Mount
action->Spectral Mount.description: A pale horse can accept a corporeal rider, but such a rider is left behind if the pale horse passes through a creature or object.

action->Aura of Despair.name: Aura of Despair
action->Aura of Despair.description: 30 feet. A living creature that begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. A creature is temporarily immune to the aura for 1 hour if it critically succeeds.

action->Spectral Charge.name: Spectral Charge
action->Spectral Charge.description: The pale horse Flies twice and then makes a horn Strike. The pale horse can move through creatures.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Crumbling Earth.name: Crumbling Earth
action->Crumbling Earth.description: The plated python lets its breath sink into the ground, transforming it to brittle stone within a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. The stone is difficult terrain to all other creatures. Other creatures on the ground in this area when it transforms must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:29] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as the stone beneath them crumbles to rubble. A creature immobilized in this way can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} normally or use three total Interact actions to dig themself free.

action->Petrify Prey.name: Petrify Prey
action->Petrify Prey.description:
Requirements The plated python has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Trigger The plated python begins its turn

Effect The python's breath seeps into the grabbed creature. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature's body hardens and stiffens, causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} for 1 round and Swallowed Whole.

Critical Failure The creature is petrified permanently and Swallowed Whole.

action->Stone Tunnel.name: Stone Tunnel
action->Stone Tunnel.description: When a plated python burrows through ground, it petrifies and destroys the material in front of it, leaving a 5-foot diameter tunnel in its wake. A plated python doesn't need to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} to pass through any space at least that wide.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Large, @Damage[(3d10+5)[acid]], Rupture 20

This damage ignores the hardness of petrified creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Towering Bite.name: Towering Bite
action->Towering Bite.description: The plated python lunges to its full length, making a jaws Strike with a reach of 60 feet. If the Strike hits, its target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and pulled to an empty space adjacent to the plated python. The python can attack through any material it can burrow through, leaving a stone tunnel as normal.

action->Hydra Regeneration.name: Hydra Regeneration
action->Hydra Regeneration.description: The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:39] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

action->Prismatic Backlash.name: Prismatic Backlash
action->Prismatic Backlash.description:
Trigger A creature successfully cauterizes one of the prismhydra's stumps

Effect The unstable prismatic energies in the prismhydra's body surge forth. Each creature adjacent to the prismhydra is exposed to its chromatic explosion.

action->Prismatic Head Regrowth.name: Prismatic Head Regrowth
action->Prismatic Head Regrowth.description:
A prismhydra ordinarily has eight heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration.

Each head requires a different type of damage to cauterize; typically, two heads each are vulnerable to acid, cold, electricity, and fire damage, but other combinations or more exotic vulnerabilities are possible. When a prismhydra successfully regrows heads, all the heads regrown have the same vulnerability, which must be the same as the vulnerability of one of the prismhydra's unsevered heads.

If all eight heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

action->Prismhydra Heads.name: Prismhydra Heads
action->Prismhydra Heads.description:
HP (head) 36, prismatic head regrowth

Immunities area damage

Weaknesses slashing 15

action->Reactive Heads.name: Reactive Heads
action->Reactive Heads.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

action->Chromatic Explosion.name: Chromatic Explosion
action->Chromatic Explosion.description: A prismhydra's heads are replete with arcane energy. Whenever the prismhydra successfully Strikes an opponent with its spittle, or when an opponent cauterizes one of the prismhydra's heads, the opponent takes 6d6 damage of the type matching the head's vulnerability (typically @Damage[6d6[acid]]{acid}, @Damage[6d6[cold]]{cold}, @Damage[6d6[fire]]{fire}, or @Damage[6d6[electricity]]{electricity}), with a @Check[reflex|dc:37|basic] save.

Protoceratops.name: Protoceratops
Protoceratops.publicNotes: Though it lacks the distinctive horns of its larger relative the triceratops, the protoceratops is more than capable of holding its own in combat, using its tail to knock enemies to the ground and its sturdy frill to turn away blows.

action->Defensive Posture.name: Defensive Posture
action->Defensive Posture.description: The protoceratops tucks in its head and presents its sturdy frill, granting a +1 circumstance bonus to AC adjacent allies. The protoceratops remains in its Defensive Posture until the start of its next turn, but only grants the bonus while allies remain adjacent

action->Frill Block.name: Frill Block
action->Frill Block.description:
Requirements The protoceratops is in its Defensive Posture

Trigger An adjacent ally would take damage from a physical attack

Effect The protoceratops partially blocks the blow with its frill, reducing the damage by 5.

Rift Chameleon.name: Rift Chameleon
Rift Chameleon.publicNotes: Rift chameleons are best known for their unsettling ability to swallow creatures significantly larger than themselves, thanks to a digestive tract that connects to its own pocket of the Ethereal Plane. When two or more rift chameleons remain in proximity for extended periods of time, their partially extradimensional nature begins to subtly warp the surrounding terrain. Direction and distance become confused to all but the lizards, making it easy for locals to get lost in places they once thought familiar.

action->Extradimensional Gullet.name: Extradimensional Gullet
action->Extradimensional Gullet.description: The rift chameleon's innards exist partially on the Ethereal Plane, allowing it to swallow any number of creatures, even ones larger than itself. Creatures that @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or cut themselves free from the chameleon's stomach reappear in the Universe adjacent to the rift chameleon's position. Creatures cannot escape from the rift chameleon's gullet using teleportation effects unless those effects can also cross planar boundaries.

action->Flickering Dash.name: Flickering Dash
action->Flickering Dash.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rift chameleon Strides twice. During this movement, it flits quickly between the Universe and the Ethereal Plane, gaining resistance 5 to physical damage.

action->Ethereal Camouflage.name: Ethereal Camouflage
action->Ethereal Camouflage.description: A rift chameleon can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, even if it doesn't have cover, but it cannot be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from creatures on the Ethereal Plane.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Large, @Damage[(1d12+2)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 10

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Tongue Pull.name: Tongue Pull
action->Tongue Pull.description: Any creature hit by the rift chameleon's tongue is pulled adjacent to the chameleon. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the next Strike the rift chameleon makes against it this round.

Royal Basilisk.name: Royal Basilisk
Royal Basilisk.publicNotes: The royal basilisk is aptly named, not for only the metal crown upon its head but also for the unique potency of its poison. The creature's poison manifests as a sort of cloying vapor that sticks onto and eats away at anything it touches. Their mastery of poison does appear to come at a cost, as the royal basilisk has no ability to petrify its prey. Although the royal basilisk can painstakingly shape a crown, some made of simple iron and others of rare skymetals, they much prefer to collect crowns crafted by other creatures.

action->Crowned Royalty.name: Crowned Royalty
action->Crowned Royalty.description: The royal basilisk's crown is firmly attached to its head but can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarmed} as though it were a held item. Without a crown, the royal basilisk's mastery over poison is weakened enough that it loses its miasmatic shroud. The royal basilisk can equip a crown within its tail's reach as an Interact action. A royal basilisk's crown is normally made of iron and enables the basilisk to use miasmatic shroud, but crowns made of other, more exotic materials might confer different abilities.

action->Miasmatic Shroud.name: Miasmatic Shroud
action->Miasmatic Shroud.description: 15 feet. The poison in the breath of the royal basilisk makes the air around it a haze, concealing it from all creatures outside the aura, but it cannot use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. When a creature ends its turn within the aura, it is exposed to royal basilisk venom.

action->Greater Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.OmV6E3aELvq9CkK1]

@Damage[(4d8+3)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.GreaterConstrict]

action->Royal Basilisk Venom.name: Royal Basilisk Venom
action->Royal Basilisk Venom.description:
Saving Throw DC 36

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[4d10[poison]], clumsy 3, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

action->Stone-Hewing Spit.name: Stone-Hewing Spit
action->Stone-Hewing Spit.description: The royal basilisk spits its poison with immense force, dealing @Damage[5d10[acid],5d8[piercing]]{5d10 acid and 5d8 piercing} damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[line|distance:240] and exposing each creature that took damage to royal basilisk venom. The line penetrates barriers with Hardness of less than 20, ignoring any bonuses they'd provide from cover. The royal basilisk can't use Stone-Hewing Spit again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Stone-Hewing Spit]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Large, @Damage[(5d10)[acid]], Rupture 30

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Wrap in Coils.name: Wrap in Coils
action->Wrap in Coils.description:
Requirements A Large or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the royal basilisk's jaws

Effect The royal basilisk moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Greater Constrict against the creature. The royal basilisk's coils can hold as many creatures as will fit in its space.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A rumindrol can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Dreadful Resonance.name: Dreadful Resonance
action->Dreadful Resonance.description: 60 feet. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure) and take @Damage[3d8[sonic]] damage.

action->Enthralling Call.name: Enthralling Call
action->Enthralling Call.description: 1 mile. Each non-rumindrol creature that enters or starts its turn within the emanation must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to this effect for 1 day (1 hour on a critical failure). Any creature fascinated in this way will attempt to find the source of the rumindrol's cry, mindlessly wandering towards it.

action->Entropic Cry.name: Entropic Cry
action->Entropic Cry.description:
The rumindrol focuses its sonic emanations on a creature it's aware of within the area of its enthralling call aura. The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The creature becomes temporarily immune to Entropic Cry for 1 hour.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is sickened 2, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The rumindrol Grabs a creature

Effect The rumindrol uses Swallow Whole.

action->Inexorable.name: Inexorable
action->Inexorable.description: The rumindrol recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Huge, @Damage[(3d10+9)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 30

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Thrash.name: Thrash
action->Thrash.description: The rumindrol attempts individual Strikes against each creature in its reach. It can attempt up to one jaws Strike and any number of leg Strikes. Each attack counts toward the rumindrol's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

action->Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Huge or smaller, leg, @Check[reflex|dc:36|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

action->Junk Nest.name: Junk Nest
action->Junk Nest.description: The scroungefeather's nest of sharp metallic junk covers a 15-foot-by-15-foot area. The area is difficult terrain and hazardous terrain to any non-scroungefeather creatures. A creature that moves on the ground through the nest takes @Damage[3[piercing]] damage for each square of the area it moves into. Scroungefeathers can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} at any point in the nest.

action->Tossed Scraps.name: Tossed Scraps
action->Tossed Scraps.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather has Grabbed Debris

Effect The scroungefeather flings the debris at a target within 20 feet, making an attack roll with a +12 modifier. On a success, the target takes @Damage[(2d10+5)[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Grab Debris.name: Grab Debris
action->Grab Debris.description:
Requirements The scroungefeather is in its nest or another environment rich with debris

Effect The scroungefeather uses an Interact action to grab an item with its beak, selected randomly; roll 1d4 to determine the type of debris. The scroungefeather gains access to the listed abilities until it uses Tossed Scraps to discard the debris or until it Releases the debris. The scroungefeather can't use its beak attack while it is using its beak to Grab Debris.

d4 Item Effect
1 Armor scrap The scroungefeather gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC.
2 Shattered blade The scroungefeather gains a broken blade melee Strike with a +12 attack modifier that deals 2d10+6 slashing damage.
3 Unexploded bomb When the scroungefeather throws this with Tossed Scraps, all the damage is fire damage, and the bomb also deals 3 fire splash damage.
4 Faulty wand The scroungefeather gains a magic bolt ranged Strike witha +14 attack modifier that deals 2d6+6 force damage.

action->Empathic Communication.name: Empathic Communication
action->Empathic Communication.description: While a shotalashu can't speak, even telepathically, it understands simple commands in the languages it knows. It returns telepathic sensations of emotion to creatures touching it or the partner of its telepathic link at any distance.

action->Telepathic Link.name: Telepathic Link
action->Telepathic Link.description: A rider who would tame a shotalashu for a mount must first form a telepathic link with it. Establishing this link require spending a week with the desired mount and succeeding at a @Check[occultism|dc:21] check. Any creature with telepathic capabilities, such as telepathy, touch telepathy, empathic sense, or the ability to cast spells such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HqTI6wRrck1YXp3F]{Telepathy}, gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this check. This link remains and neither can form a new link until one member dies. The shock of a partner dying leaves the survivor @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 24 hours and prevents forming a new link for at least a month.

action->Jungle Stride.name: Jungle Stride
action->Jungle Stride.description: The shotalashu ignores difficult terrain due to vegetation.

action->Telepathic Pounce.name: Telepathic Pounce
action->Telepathic Pounce.description:
The shotalashu hunts by pinning its foes with its mind. One creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a â€“5 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round.

Failure The creature takes a â€“10 foot status penalty to its Speeds for one round. The shotalashu can then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for one round. The shotalashu can Leap.

action->Transparency.name: Transparency
action->Transparency.description: Unless it has fed recently, the sky fisher is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. Using non-hostile actions does not cause the sky fisher to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}. When it takes a hostile action of any kind, the sky fisher is hidden instead of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} until the start of its next turn, as the vague outline of its many tendrils temporarily becomes faintly visible.

action->Abduct.name: Abduct
action->Abduct.description: The sky fisher reels in a target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by its tentacles, pulling them into an adjacent space, and then attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]{Swallow them Whole} (Large, @Damage[(3d8+12)[acid]], Rupture 25). The sky fisher can only use Swallow Whole when using Abduct.

action->Enzymic Vent.name: Enzymic Vent
action->Enzymic Vent.description: The sky fisher vents flesh-eating enzymes into the air, dealing @Damage[3d6[persistent,acid],3d6[bleed]]{3d6 persistent acid damage and 3d6 persistent bleed damage} in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). It can't use Enzymic Vent again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Enzymic Vent]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Jet.name: Jet
action->Jet.description: The sky fisher quickly expels some of its gases to move swiftly through the air, Flying up to 100 feet in a straight line; this movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Sky Fisher Venom.name: Sky Fisher Venom
action->Sky Fisher Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and can't speak above a whisper (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and can't speak (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Soniphak.name: Soniphak
Soniphak.publicNotes:
Dischorans are a group of predators who hunt via focused sound. Though they possess protuberances that resemble eyes, these are actually auditory sensory organs that can pick up even the slightest sound and are used to locate prey with pinpoint accuracy.

Only a few types of dischorans have been identified, but they all share unifying features: front-facing pseudo-eyes, deceptive speed, and ravenous hunger. Their sensitivity to noise combined with their ability to weaponize sound are likely the primary reasons dischorans spend most of their time alone.

Often mistaken for drakes, soniphaks glide above rocky or barren ground, picking out prey with their hearing. A hunting soniphak disables its targets with concentrated bursts of sound before snatching them up and feasting on the move. Despite being able to speak, soniphaks are no more social than other dischorans, generally responding to even the quietest attempts at communication with destructive shouting.

action->Sensitive Echolocation.name: Sensitive Echolocation
action->Sensitive Echolocation.description: The soniphak can use its hearing as a precise sense with the listed range. If the soniphak takes sonic damage beyond its resistance, its senses are overloaded and all creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from it for 1 round.

action->Snatch.name: Snatch
action->Snatch.description: The soniphak can Fly at half Speed with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claws, carrying that creature along with it.

action->Aftershock.name: Aftershock
action->Aftershock.description: Whenever a soniphak hits with a screech Strike, feedback deals each creature the soniphak has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} @Damage[1d6[sonic]] damage.

action->Disruptive Screech.name: Disruptive Screech
action->Disruptive Screech.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the soniphak uses an auditory action

Effect The soniphak makes a screech Strike against the triggering creature. This disrupts a triggering concentrate action if the Strike is a critical hit.

action->Shattering Scream.name: Shattering Scream
action->Shattering Scream.description: The soniphak can focus its screech at a stone or rock surface within 60 feet to create an explosion in a @Template[burst|distance:15] from the point of impact. Creatures in the area take @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain due to fragments of loose stone.

Sporeback Frog.name: Sporeback Frog
Sporeback Frog.publicNotes: This burrowing frog digs itself into moist earth so poisonous moss and toxic mushrooms can grow on its body.

0.label: to High Jump or Long Jump

action->Seed Spores.name: Seed Spores
action->Seed Spores.description: A creature hit by the sporeback frog's tongue Strike takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] damage as fungal spores begin to grow.

action->Soporific Spores.name: Soporific Spores
action->Soporific Spores.description: The sporeback frog shakes the plants and fungi on its back until they emit a cloud of spores in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. All creatures in the area must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure). This ability can't be used again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Soporific Spores]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Skymetal Metamorphosis.name: Skymetal Metamorphosis
action->Skymetal Metamorphosis.description:
Each stargut hydra has at least one metamorphosis resulting from consuming a specific skymetal and internalizing its properties. If you give a stargut hydra more than one metamorphosis, you should consider increasing its level and changing its statistics.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.Bds5RP9grJxhZALW]{Adamantine} The stargut hydra's Strikes bypass Hardness and are treated as adamantine. The stargut hydra gains resistance 10 to physical damage (except adamantine).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.lFRU108HnGlnMwqS]{Abysium} (aura, poison) The stargut hydra emits an aura of nauseating radiation from the abysium in its body. Any creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the stargut hydra is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.N4l6y6v9pKy8Nj5i]{Djezet} (magical) The stargut hydra gains a +2 status bonus to saves against magic.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.5bRdhgghjtWF1Vuu]{Inubrix} The stargut hydra's Strikes ignore resistance to damage from metal armor's armor specialization effects and do not trigger the Shield Block reaction or reactions from armor property runes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.sTlptNnUX2eA0DIH]{Noqual} The stargut hydra's Strikes and abilities gain a +2 status bonus to damage against creatures with the ability to Cast a Spell.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.6Z0v9Tsthm9hyzb3]{Orichalcum} When the stargut hydra has only two heads remaining, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. It can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.SXJRjw4R8m7NPDGc]{Siccatite} After the stargut hydra takes fire damage, it becomes superheated, gaining immunity to fire and weakness 10 to cold. While superheated, cold damage can be used to cauterize a stump. After the stargut hydra takes cold damage, it becomes chilled, gaining immunity to cold and weakness 10 to fire.

action->Hydra Regeneration.name: Hydra Regeneration
action->Hydra Regeneration.description: The stargut hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:29] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

action->Head Regrowth.name: Head Regrowth
action->Head Regrowth.description:
A stargut hydra ordinarily has five heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the hydra's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A hydra can regrow a severed head using hydra regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing acid or fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target acid or fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal acid or fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any acid or fire damage, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all five heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

action->Reactive Heads.name: Reactive Heads
action->Reactive Heads.description: A stargut hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

action->Vomit Meteorites.name: Vomit Meteorites
action->Vomit Meteorites.description: The stargut hydra lurches its entire body, spewing forth chunks of meteorite in a @Template[cone|distance:30] that deal @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]). The area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, though a creature can use an Interact action to clear one square of the rubble. The stargut hydra can't Vomit Meteorites for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Vomit Meteorites]]{1d4 rounds}.

Stonefish.name: Stonefish
Stonefish.publicNotes: Stonefish use their superior camouflage to lie in wait and devour small prey, becoming indistinguishable from the reefs they call home. Larger creatures are also at risk, although mostly through accidental contact with the stonefish's spines and their agonizing venom.

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: The stonefish can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in its natural environment even if it doesn't have cover.

action->Defensive Spines.name: Defensive Spines
action->Defensive Spines.description: When a creature moves into a space with one or more stonefish, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish venom.

action->Stonefish Venom.name: Stonefish Venom
action->Stonefish Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 3 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and clumsy 2 (1 hour)

Stonefish Swarm.name: Stonefish Swarm
Stonefish Swarm.publicNotes: Stonefish occasionally band together where food is abundant, filling all nooks and crannies of a coral reef. In large numbers, stonefish can take on prey much larger than themselves.

action->Defensive Spines.name: Defensive Spines
action->Defensive Spines.description: When a creature enters the stonefish swarm's space, that creature takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and is exposed to stonefish swarm venom.

action->Reef Camouflage.name: Reef Camouflage
action->Reef Camouflage.description: Until the next time it acts, the stonefish swarm appears to be a colorful coral reef. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a reef.

action->Inject Poison.name: Inject Poison
action->Inject Poison.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). Creatures that fail the save are exposed to stonefish swarm venom.

action->Stonefish Swarm Venom.name: Stonefish Swarm Venom
action->Stonefish Swarm Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 1d6 poison and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and clumsy 2 (1 round)

action->Echolocation.name: Echolocation
action->Echolocation.description: The stony bat can use hearing as a precise sense with the listed range.

action->Petrify Body Part.name: Petrify Body Part
action->Petrify Body Part.description:
The stony bat breathes a puff of petrifying gas onto an adjacent creature, targeting a specific body part. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be partially petrified for 1 minute, with an effect varying with the body part targeted.

  • Face The creature's face stiffens and a film of stone partially blocks its vision. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}.
  • Hand One of the creature's hands is petrified. It cannot Release items from that hand or use the hand for fine manipulation. Attack rolls with weapons held in that hand take a â€“2 status penalty.
  • Leg A patch of the creature's leg becomes inflexible and heavy. It takes a â€“10 status penalty to its Speed. If all of the creature's legs become petrified in this way, the creature's Speed is reduced down to 5 feet. At the GM's discretion, a creature with movement that doesn't rely on legs, such as creatures that Fly with wings, don't take a penalty to these other Speeds.

action->Petrify Vapor.name: Petrify Vapor
action->Petrify Vapor.description: The stony bat breathes petrifying gas in a @Template[cone|distance:15], too thin to harm creatures in the area. However, it petrifies ambient moisture, raining down a cascade of tiny stones onto any creatures in the space directly below the cone. The falling rocks deal @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic]). The stony bat can't use Petrify Vapor again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Petrify Vapor]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Stone Feast.name: Stone Feast
action->Stone Feast.description: The stony bat specifically targets petrified body parts, which it can consume, unlike flesh. The stony bat's jaws deal an extra 1d6 damage against a creature that has been petrified, either partially or completely, and ignore the Hardness of petrified creatures.

action->Cliff Climber.name: Cliff Climber
action->Cliff Climber.description: A stony goat can trot across the steepest cliffs. It doesn't need to attempt @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} checks to scale inclines, and it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while Climbing an incline. It ignores difficult terrain caused by rocks, rubble, and uneven ground made of earth and stone.

action->Self-Petrify.name: Self-Petrify
action->Self-Petrify.description:
Trigger The stony goat gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition or takes more than 8 damage in a single hit

Effect The stony goat turns to stone in self-defense. It gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} condition for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. If the goat is damaged while it's petrified, it immediately heals by that amount by absorbing minerals from its cud, causing its cud to lose value equal to the amount of Hit Points restored (for instance, losing 5 gp worth of value to restore 5 Hit Points); if the goat's cud is reduced to 0 gp, it has the minerals fully drained from it, and the goat won't form more cud until it has eaten a sufficient quantity of rock and slept.

action->Overhead Leap.name: Overhead Leap
action->Overhead Leap.description: The stony goat @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 12 feet vertically and 20 feet horizontally; this movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Shove and Run.name: Shove and Run
action->Shove and Run.description: The stony goat attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the nearest creature and then Strides with a +20-foot circumstance bonus to Speed.

action->Stone Bolt.name: Stone Bolt
action->Stone Bolt.description:
Trigger The stony goat loses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} condition

Effect The stony goat's first instinct is to escape. It Strides with a +20 circumstance bonus to its Speed.

action->Static Shock.name: Static Shock
action->Static Shock.description:
Trigger A creature touches the storm snake or damages it with an unarmed melee attack or non-reach melee weapon

Effect The triggering enemy is shocked for @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save). On a failed save, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Lightning Strike.name: Lightning Strike
action->Lightning Strike.description: The storm snake redirects the lightning it has absorbed from storms, dealing @Damage[2d10[electricity]] damage to a single target within 20 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save). On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of its next turn.

action->Static Field.name: Static Field
action->Static Field.description:
The storm snake gathers all static electricity in the area before releasing it in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that deals @Damage[3d12[electricity]] damage to all non-plant creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:19] save) and grants plant creatures 5 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute. Plant life in the area begins to grow significantly faster than the average for plants of their genus; in forests, fields, or otherwise floral locations, this immediately transforms the area into non-magical difficult terrain. The storm snake can't use Static field again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Static Field]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MGlENdqYCAwBkyXt]{Effect: Static Field}

spell->Truespeech (Constant).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
Truespeech (Constant)

action->Reactive Strike (Tail Only).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KAVf7AmRnbCAHrkT]
Reactive Strike (Tail Only)

action->Bond with Mortal.name: Bond with Mortal
action->Bond with Mortal.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The spirit guide spends 10 minutes to form a bond with a mortal creature. While the bond exists, the spirit guide increases their current and maximum Hit Points by 28, gains a +2 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and can communicate telepathically with the bonded mortal as long as the two beings are on the same plane. The spirit guide can only be bonded with one mortal at a time, and they can take this action again to end the bond or to form a new bond (which also ends the old bond). The bond also ends if the spirit guide or the mortal dies.

This bond strengthens the spirit guide's connection to the Universe. While bonded, the spirit guide loses the incorporeal and spirit traits, loses their immunity to disease, paralysis, and poison, along with their resistance to all damage, and changes their Strikes to deal the appropriate amount of physical damage (typically piercing or slashing) instead of force damage.

action->Bonded Strike.name: Bonded Strike
action->Bonded Strike.description:
Requirements The sunscale serpent is currently Bonded with a Mortal

Effect The sunscale serpent makes a jaws Strike. If this attack hits, the bonded mortal can spend their reaction to Strike the same target.

action->Sun's Heat.name: Sun's Heat
action->Sun's Heat.description: The sunscale serpent Flies up to its fly Speed. All creatures directly below the spaces it moves through must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save or be exposed to sun's touch poison. The serpent cannot fly further than 60 feet above the target or the poison becomes too dispersed in the fall to take effect.

action->Sun's Touch.name: Sun's Touch
action->Sun's Touch.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 round)

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Large, @Damage[(2d10+9)[force],(2d10)[fire]]{2d10+9 force and 2d10 fire}, Rupture 32

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Unleash the Sun.name: Unleash the Sun
action->Unleash the Sun.description:
Requirements The sunscale serpent is flying

Effect The sunscale serpent Flies up to its fly Speed, then crashes to the ground, releasing a wave of heat dealing @Damage[5d10[fire]] damage to all creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:60] and searing their eyes with the erupting glory of its scales. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:31] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round, and dazzled for 1 minute.

Swordfish.name: Swordfish
Swordfish.publicNotes: Contrary to popular belief, the bill of the swordfish is not used for impaling its prey, but to stun or slash. Specialized organs help keep it warm in the coldest waters, increasing its already considerable speed and reflexes.

action->Warm Brain.name: Warm Brain
action->Warm Brain.description:
Requirements The swordfish is in cold water

Trigger The swordfish rolls initiative

Effect The swordfish @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swims}.

action->Fast Sweep.name: Fast Sweep
action->Fast Sweep.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The swordfish makes two bill Strikes against two adjacent targets, with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack rolls.

action->Studded Cheeks.name: Studded Cheeks
action->Studded Cheeks.description: The cave squirrel can store up to six gems in its cheeks. It typically begins combat with all six, and it loses a gem each time it uses gem spit.

action->Defensive Scream.name: Defensive Scream
action->Defensive Scream.description:
Trigger The cave squirrel rolls initiative or has taken damage before initiative

Effect The cave squirrel lets out an ear-piercing shriek, alerting any other cave squirrels in the area to its plight. It uses Screaming Force.

action->Concussive Gem.name: Concussive Gem
action->Concussive Gem.description: On a critical hit on a gem spit Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Forage for Gems.name: Forage for Gems
action->Forage for Gems.description: The cave squirrel dives underground in search of gems. The cave squirrel Burrows up to its Speed. It must end its movement back on the surface. During its burrow, it happens upon [[/br 1d4 #Gems]] cheap gems (such as salt or quartz), which it stuffs in its cheeks, up to its maximum of 6.

action->Natural Speed.name: Natural Speed
action->Natural Speed.description: A cave squirrel isn't affected by difficult terrain from earth or stone.

action->Screaming Force.name: Screaming Force
action->Screaming Force.description: The cave squirrel lets out a terrible scream. Nonâ€“cave squirrel creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or take @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage. On a critical failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. The cave squirrel can't use Screaming Force again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Screaming Force]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Eyespots.name: Eyespots
action->Eyespots.description: A tardigrade swarm can't see anything beyond 30 feet.

action->Tun Marbles.name: Tun Marbles
action->Tun Marbles.description: As the tardigrade swarm is damaged, the bodies of those that enter a tun state make the ground treacherous. When the tardigrade swarm drops below 70 Hit Points, the space they occupy is considered difficult terrain.

action->Stylets.name: Stylets
action->Stylets.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). Creatures that fail their save become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increase their drained condition by one, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Therizinosaurus.name: Therizinosaurus
Therizinosaurus.publicNotes: At first glance, the therizinosaurus, with its rotund, feathered body and bird-like beak, strikes many observers as almost comical. This impression tends to quickly fade at the sight of the creature's claws, six wicked, scythelike blades capable of disemboweling a foe with a single well-placed slash. Despite their intimidating appearance, these enormous claws are used primarily to separate tasty leaves and branches from the tops of the tall trees upon which the therizinosaurus feeds. Nonetheless, travelers through a therizinosaurus's territory are wisely advised to give the creature a wide berth, less they wind up on the wrong end of its notoriously foul temper.

action->Stomp Pests.name: Stomp Pests
action->Stomp Pests.description: The therizinosaurus stomps about, dealing @Damage[5d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save) to each adjacent creature. Large or smaller creatures who fail their save are also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Swiping Claws.name: Swiping Claws
action->Swiping Claws.description: The therizinosaurus makes two claw Strikes against different targets. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but do not increase the penalty until it has made both attacks.

action->Winnowing Claws.name: Winnowing Claws
action->Winnowing Claws.description: Whenever the therizinosaurus successfully Strikes a Large or smaller creature with its claw, it pulls that creature 5 feet toward it (10 feet on a critical hit).

Thruneosaurus Rex.name: Thruneosaurus Rex
Thruneosaurus Rex.publicNotes: The unholy terror known as the thruneosaurus rex is not a natural beast. They were created by Chelaxian diabolists who sought to combine the ferocity of dinosaurs with the power of Hell, infusing a clutch of tyrannosaurus rex eggs from Mediogalti Island with devil ichor and naming the monstrous hatchlings after their patrons. Although few records and fewer survivors tell exactly how the experiment went awry, the experimental subjects escaped, and their descendants are now most often sighted in the Whisperwood in eastern Cheliax.

action->Frightful Presence.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]

90 feet @Check[will|dc:38]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

action->Instinctive Teleportation.name: Instinctive Teleportation
action->Instinctive Teleportation.description:
Trigger The thruneosaurus takes damage from a holy effect

Effect The thruneosaurus teleports to an open space within 60 feet it can see, along with any creatures it has swallowed whole.

action->Hellfire Blast.name: Hellfire Blast
action->Hellfire Blast.description:
The thruneosaurus channels sulfurous hellfire in one of three ways. The thruneosaurus chooses the effect, but it can't make the same choice in two consecutive rounds.

  • Blistering Sun (divine, fire, unholy) The thruneosaurus ignites an orb of hellfire between its horns that radiates heat in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[2d8[persistent,fire]] damage.
  • Choking Fumes (divine, poison, unholy) The thruneosaurus exhales a @Template[cone|distance:60] of sulfurous smoke that deals @Damage[6d8[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:38|traits:divine,poison,unholy|basic] save). Creatures that fail their saves are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.
  • Fiery Beam (divine, fire, unholy) A @Template[line|distance:120] of hellish flame erupts from the thruneosaurus's eyes, dealing @Damage[6d10[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|traits:divine,fire,unholy|basic] save).

action->Swallow Whole.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.uJSseLa57HZYSMUu]

Huge, @Damage[(3d12+10)[bludgeoning]], Rupture 40

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SwallowWhole]

action->Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Huge or smaller, foot, @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Titanosaur.name: Titanosaur
Titanosaur.publicNotes: Titanosaurs are some of the largest land animals ever to walk the surface of Golarion, massive sauropods that can reach over 100 feet in length and weigh more than 80 tons. While typically content to focus on consuming vast quantities of vegetation and ignore the presence of smaller creatures, titanosaurs that feel threatened can unleash destruction rivaling natural disasters.

action->Majestic Presence.name: Majestic Presence
action->Majestic Presence.description:
90 feet. Creatures of Huge size or smaller that enter the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:38] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the titanosaur's Majestic Presence for 1 hour.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the titanosaur for 1 round.

Failure The creature is fascinated for 2 rounds.

Critical Failure The creature is fascinated for 1 minute.

action->Seismic Slam.name: Seismic Slam
action->Seismic Slam.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The titanosaur rears up on its hind legs before slamming its forelegs back on the ground with a thunderous crash, creating a localized tremor with the effects of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.x7SPrsRxGb2Vy2nu]{Earthquake} spell centered on itself, though the effect is non-magical. Fissures do not form under the titanosaur.

action->Sweeping Tail.name: Sweeping Tail
action->Sweeping Tail.description: The titanosaur lashes its tail in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:38|basic] save). The momentum of the titanosaur's swing then makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of its next turn.

action->Trample.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]

Huge or smaller, foot, @Check[reflex|dc:38|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

Troodon.name: Troodon
Troodon.publicNotes: Troodons stand roughly 3 feet tall and twice as long, with slender necks and large, inquisitive eyes. Although they don't fully understand language, troodons have a remarkable talent for speech mimicry.

action->Mimicry.name: Mimicry
action->Mimicry.description: The troodon repeats up to twelve words it heard in the last week. If it succeeds at a @Check[deception|defense:perception] check against the listeners' Perception DC, the sound is indistinguishable from the original. The troodon can't duplicate voice-based abilities or spells, although it can mimic the verbal sounds of spellcasting.

action->Running Attack.name: Running Attack
action->Running Attack.description: The troodon Strides and makes a claw Strike at any point during that movement.

action->Hydra Regeneration.name: Hydra Regeneration
action->Hydra Regeneration.description:
On a failure the tyrafdir grows two illusory heads.

The hydra has regeneration equal to 3 Ã— the number of heads it has. If a hydra's body is missing any heads and the remaining stumps have not been cauterized, the hydra attempts a @Check[fortitude|immutable:true|dc:31] save after it regains Hit Points from regeneration. On a success, one uncauterized stump regrows two heads; on a critical success, two uncauterized stumps regrow into two heads each. The hydra can never grow more than double the number of heads it ordinarily has. The hydra's regeneration only fully deactivates if all its heads are severed and all stumps are cauterized, at which point it dies.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Regeneration]

action->Deceptive Heads.name: Deceptive Heads
action->Deceptive Heads.description:
A tyrafdir is cunning, if unintelligent, using illusions of regrown heads to confuse and harry opponents. When a tyrafdir fails, but does not critically fail, its Fortitude save to regrow a head, a phantasm materializes to mimic the regrowth. This creates two deceptive heads that function differently than real heads. The tyrafdir gains a deceptive jaws Strike as long as it has at least one deceptive head. Any creature that attacks a deceptive head or uses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve the illusion (@Check[will|dc:27] save).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NZ3MrmXkmfQuJp7S]{Effect: Deceptive Heads}

action->Deceptive Regrowth.name: Deceptive Regrowth
action->Deceptive Regrowth.description:
A tyrafdir ordinarily has six heads. A creature can attempt to sever one of the tyrafdir's heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's Hit Points. A head that is not completely severed returns to full Hit Points at the end of any creature's turn. A tyrafdir can regrow a severed head using Hydra Regeneration. A creature can prevent this regrowth by dealing fire damage to the stump, cauterizing it. Single-target fire effects need to be targeted at a specific stump, but effects that deal splash damage or affect areas covering the hydra's whole space cauterize all stumps if they deal fire damage. If the attack that severs a head deals any fire damage or is dealt by a cold-iron weapon, the stump is cauterized instantly. If all six heads are cauterized, the hydra dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{Effect: Hydra Heads}

action->Reactive Heads.name: Reactive Heads
action->Reactive Heads.description: A hydra gains an extra reaction per round for each of its heads beyond the first, which it can use only to make Reactive Strikes. It can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within its reach, and the hydra must use a different head for each Reactive Strike it makes. Whenever one of the hydra's heads is severed, the hydra loses 1 of its extra reactions per round.

action->Tyrafdir Heads.name: Tyrafdir Heads
action->Tyrafdir Heads.description:
HP (head) 30, deceptive regrowth

Immunities area damage

Weakness cold iron 10, slashing 10

action->Noxious Exhalation.name: Noxious Exhalation
action->Noxious Exhalation.description:
The tyrafdir breathes out a noxious mist from all of its mouths, spreading in a @Template[emanation|distance:20] that deals @Damage[4d10[poison]] damage to creatures within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). Any creature that fails its save must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save or gain weakness to mental 10 and a â€“1 status penalty to Will saves for 24 hours. The tyrafdir can't use Noxious Exhalation again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Noxious Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.G1pvduwOVRz4YFUF]{Effect: Noxious Exhalation}

action->Feel No Pain.name: Feel No Pain
action->Feel No Pain.description:
Trigger The vibrant pup swarm is critically hit by a Strike

Effect The worker pups become insensitive to pain and leap to the front. The swarm gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round.

action->Reflective Skin.name: Reflective Skin
action->Reflective Skin.description: 10 feet. Other creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}. The aura automatically activates when the swarm is in bright light and deactivates in dim light or darkness.

action->Focused Reflection.name: Focused Reflection
action->Focused Reflection.description:
Requirements The vibrant pup swarm is in bright light

Effect The swarm simultaneously turns to focus the light in an arcing beam, dealing @Damage[(6d12)[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure). The swarm can't use Focused Reflection again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Focused Reflection]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[(2d6)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save).

action->Counter-Melody.name: Counter-Melody
action->Counter-Melody.description:
Trigger An opponent within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Effect The virtuosic lyrebird makes a counteract check against the triggering spell ([[/r 1d20+14 #Counteract]]{+14} counteract modifier).

action->Arcane Harmony.name: Arcane Harmony
action->Arcane Harmony.description:
Effect The virtuosic lyrebird sings a subtle trill that others can use to embellish their magic. The next virtuosic lyrebird to Cast a Spell within 60 feet of the first lyrebird that used Arcane Harmony chooses one of the following two benefits, after which the Arcane Harmony ends.

  • The spell gains a +2 status bonus to damage per spell rank.
  • One target of the spell takes a â€“2 status penalty to saves against the spell.

action->Spell Mimicry.name: Spell Mimicry
action->Spell Mimicry.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements A creature Casts a Spell of 3rd rank or lower since the end of the virtuosic lyrebird' s last turn, and the virtuosic lyrebird heard the incantation for the spell

Effect The virtuosic lyrebird learns the spell enough to mimic and cast it this turn, using as many actions as the original spell took.

action->Spellsong Casting.name: Spellsong Casting
action->Spellsong Casting.description: The virtuosic lyrebird's exquisite vocal control lets it cast spells purely through its song. While it must be able to vocalize to Cast a Spell, it doesn't need to gesture, removing the manipulate trait from any spell that it casts. If it Casts a Spell with the linguistic trait (usually with its Spell Mimicry), it can Cast that Spell in Common, even though the bird doesn't truly understand the language.

Warden of Caverns and Burrows.name: Warden of Caverns and Burrows
Warden of Caverns and Burrows.publicNotes:
The Connected Depths

As much as air currents flow through the skies, and the oceans connect the waters of world, the caverns and depths connect to each other as well, via several means. Underground flows of lava create tunnels and passages. Water's erosion also forms cave systems out of the stone.

0.label: to High Jump or Long Jump

action->Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense (Imprecise) 60 feet

<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.QOwFuM3LwNzOSb6B]

action->Magmatic Reflex.name: Magmatic Reflex
action->Magmatic Reflex.description:
Trigger The warden is targeted with an attack

Effect The warden issues a spray of magma as they jump away from danger. This spray deals @Damage[6d12[fire]] damage to all adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save). They then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} or Step away, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack.

action->Bury Beneath Stone.name: Bury Beneath Stone
action->Bury Beneath Stone.description:
Requirements The warden has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The warden attempts to wedge a creature they have grabbed in their mandibles within a crack in the earth that opens beneath them. The warden attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:reflex] check against the grabbed creature's Reflex DC. If they succeed, they bury the creature in the ground. The creature takes @Damage[10d10[bludgeoning]] damage. It is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and has to hold its breath or start suffocating until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 42). If the creature is still buried at the end of its turn, it takes @Damage[5d10[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Called to Depths.name: Called to Depths
action->Called to Depths.description: The depths call to the warden, especially as they move through the air. When they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, they can use any unused movement from the Long Jump to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow}. Additionally, the warden can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When they do so, they move at their full burrow Speed.

action->Erupting Jump.name: Erupting Jump
action->Erupting Jump.description: The warden draws out a stream of lava, then jumps off the solidifying mass as it cools. The warden @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to twice their Speed. When they land, the force of the impact deals @Damage[6d12[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:15] with a @Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save. On a critical failure, the creature is also pushed 10 feet away from the warden.

action->Obsidian Cage.name: Obsidian Cage
action->Obsidian Cage.description: Rapidly cooling obsidian clings to the target's body and stiffens around their limbs. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} (DC 42). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for as long as they remain immobilized.

action->Vibratory Excavation.name: Vibratory Excavation
action->Vibratory Excavation.description: The warden screeches with a resonant call that tears apart earth and stone. They create a 10-foot-square, 50-foot-deep pit in earthen material or stone within 60 feet.

action->Wall Cling.name: Wall Cling
action->Wall Cling.description: The Warden of Caverns and Burrows clings to surfaces with their segmented feet. They do not need to use a hand to hold on to walls or ceilings.

action->Wild Trickery.name: Wild Trickery
action->Wild Trickery.description:
Trigger An enemy within 60 feet targets the warden with an attack, spell, or other ability

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:45] save. If it fails, the warden redirects the ability to target a different creature in range with a burst of mental laughter; this has no effect if there are no other eligible targets. The triggering creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours unless it critically failed.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

The warden transforms his size to Tiny, Small, Medium, or Huge (changing his reach to 0 feet for Tiny, 5 feet for Medium or Large, and 10 feet for Huge). The warden retains his shape but can change his color to any seasonal array.

action->Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
action->Forest Passage.description: The Warden of Forests and Meadows ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

action->Fox's Wager.name: Fox's Wager
action->Fox's Wager.description:
The warden grants a boon to a willing creature he can see other than himself, requesting that the creature promise to use the granted power to destroy or undermine the creations of civilization. The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +5 status bonus to damage against constructs, objects, and structures constructed by humanoids. It also gains a +2 status bonus to Stealth checks against humanoids. The warden can have only one wager granted at a time. The wager ends if the target is captured or dies.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Hc0BhuLHaldO3vqG]{Effect: Fox's Wager}

action->Idyllic Panorama.name: Idyllic Panorama
action->Idyllic Panorama.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The warden creates an area of peaceful calm. This is identical to a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} depicting a peaceful meadow or forest, except the area is a @Template[burst|distance:200].

While within the area of an Idyllic Panorama, the warden has significant control over the senses of creatures within the area and can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPXzPl7YbMEIGWfi]{Mislead} and 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gIdDLrbswTV3OBJy]{Silence} at will.

action->Magical Pounce.name: Magical Pounce
action->Magical Pounce.description: The warden Strides up to his Speed, Leaps up to his Speed, or casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}; at the end of that movement, the warden Strikes. If the warden began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, he remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The warden deals an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Warden of Oceans and Rivers.name: Warden of Oceans and Rivers
Warden of Oceans and Rivers.publicNotes:
A Vengeful Present

In past eras, the Warden of Oceans and Rivers was once connected to the world of landed creatures and deeply involved in their channels of commerce. Now the descendants of these creatures are unable to rely on the bounty of the sea and feel that they must take what they can to survive. Fishing folk must be swift and deliberate now that the oceans and rivers zealously protect their goods. It is for this reason not all agree with the new warden's tacticsâ€¦ and some wish to see the old ways restored.

action->Bioluminescent Maelstrom.name: Bioluminescent Maelstrom
action->Bioluminescent Maelstrom.description:
30 feet @Check[will|dc:45]

The warden's wrath conjures a dazzling storm around them that makes the area difficult terrain. Creatures that enter the storm must attempt a Will save. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to the luring visuals for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round, and for the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to move as close to the warden as possible.

Critical Failure The creature is dazzled for as long as it remains in the aura. Whenever the creature begins its turn within the aura, the creature must use the first action of its turn to move as close to the warden as possible. It can attempt a new save at the end of its turn, ending this effect on a success.

action->All Are One.name: All Are One
action->All Are One.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The warden attracts organisms that extend their influence. The area of bioluminescent maelstrom and the reach of their tentacle Strike increase by 10 feet for 1 minute, to a maximum of an additional 30 feet.

action->Arctic Embrace.name: Arctic Embrace
action->Arctic Embrace.description: All creatures in the warden's bioluminescent maelstrom take @Damage[10d6[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic] save). On a failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

action->Grasp of the Deep.name: Grasp of the Deep
action->Grasp of the Deep.description:
Creatures struck by one of the warden's tentacles gain cold weakness 10 and take a â€“2 status penalty to Fortitude saves for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HzPg4iUmO3F6tbK6]{Effect: Grasp of the Deep}

action->I Am The Tide.name: I Am The Tide
action->I Am The Tide.description: The warden creates three lines of rushing water, each @Template[line|distance:120|width:10]{10 feet wide and 120 feet long}. Creatures in the area take @Damage[18d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:45|basic] save). The warden can either push or pull, and all creatures that fail this save move up to 40 feet in the direction chosen. The warden can't use I Am The Tide again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge I Am The Tide]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->What Lurks Beneath.name: What Lurks Beneath
action->What Lurks Beneath.description: The warden attacks with their tentacles six times.

Warden of Peaks and Skies.name: Warden of Peaks and Skies
Warden of Peaks and Skies.publicNotes:
Warden's Blessing

Legend says that the Warden of Peaks and Sky invites those who particularly earn their favor into their home, a nest within a hollow peak deep in the Kodar Mountains. There, the guest is treated to a grand feast, after which the warden offers to turn them into a thunderbird so they might enjoy the sky for the rest of their days, though they are not offended if anyone demurs.

action->Stormsight.name: Stormsight
action->Stormsight.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair the warden's vision; she ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.

action->Crystal Exhalation.name: Crystal Exhalation
action->Crystal Exhalation.description: The warden breathes, creating a storm of ice crystals. All creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60] take @Damage[4d8[cold],4d8[slashing]]{4d8 cold damage and 4d8 slashing damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:44|basic] save). On a critical failure, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by ice. The warden then can't use Crystal Exhalation for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Crystal Exhalation]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Orogenesis Dive.name: Orogenesis Dive
action->Orogenesis Dive.description: The warden flies 240 feet upward in a straight line. As she does so, the ground in a @Template[burst|distance:30] from her starting point rises into a 120-foot-high rocky pillar topped with a mountainous peak that becomes greater difficult terrain. All other creatures in that burst must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} by the sudden altitude shift. The warden then flies straight downward to the center of the pillar's peak, driving her horns into the stone. As she lands, the newly formed mountains tremble. All other creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save or plummet off the peaks, falling 120 feet and landing in the nearest square outside the area. The pillar is permanent.

action->Song of the Skies.name: Song of the Skies
action->Song of the Skies.description:
The warden trills a cheerful birdsong, granting a boon to all allies within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} and evoking the freedom of flight. For the next minute, affected allies gain @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement}, a fly speed of 60 feet, and treat creatures on the ground as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} when they are airborne.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dZDpfgU63rXbBHpe]{Effect: Song of the Skies}

action->Tempest Downdrafts.name: Tempest Downdrafts
action->Tempest Downdrafts.description:
Trigger The warden Flies

Effect s The warden's flapping wings generate powerful gusts that blow smaller creatures off course. A @Template[emanation|distance:60], centered on the warden, fills with lightning-pierced winds until the beginning of the warden's next turn. Creatures must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:42] save to take any move action within the winds; flying creatures use the outcome one degree of success worse than what they roll. Creatures who critically fail are blown 30 feet away from the warden, knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and take @Damage[4d6[electricity]] damage.

action->Deer Empathy.name: Deer Empathy
action->Deer Empathy.description: A weremoose can communicate with deer, including moose.

action->Cold Adaptation.name: Cold Adaptation
action->Cold Adaptation.description: The weremoose treats environmental cold effects as if they were one step less extreme.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

Medium human with fist +11 for 1d4+6 bludgeoning,

or

Large moose with antler and hoof +11 for 1d8+6 bludgeoning.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Curse of the Weremoose.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ICnpftxZEilrYjn0]
Curse of the Weremoose
action->Curse of the Weremoose.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ICnpftxZEilrYjn0]

This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

action->Moon Frenzy.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.FA0ri2fAcMa1HgZe]
Moon Frenzy
action->Moon Frenzy.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.FA0ri2fAcMa1HgZe]

When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its antlers by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

action->Thundering Charge.name: Thundering Charge
action->Thundering Charge.description: The weremoose Strides twice and then makes an antler Strike. A Medium or smaller creature damaged by this attack must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: The wereshark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Change Shape.description:

Medium human with fist +14 for 1d4+7 bludgeoning,

action->Curse of the Wereshark.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ICnpftxZEilrYjn0]

This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

action->Fish Fork.name: Fish Fork
action->Fish Fork.description:
Requirements The wereshark critically hit with a trident Strike on their most recent action this turn

Effect The wereshark digs their trident deep within their target, skewering it before taking a massive bite. The target of the Strike becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 18) and takes @Damage[1d4[bleed]] damage, and the wereshark attempts a jaws Strike against it. The wereshark can't use their trident while they have a creature grabbed with it, but they can pull the trident free with a single action that has the manipulate trait.
